lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Others, however, were more optimistic, saying evidence was already in hand that Japan has cut back prodution and halted sales to the grey market, the third country brokers that sell chips at below production costs.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: He said Japanese manufactures were likely to view MITI's request unfavorably because chip capacity was still high and production cut backs would lead to significant write-offs in plant and equipment.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: "We've seen the grey market begin to dry up for D-RAMS, and it has virtually dried up for EPROMS," said Merrill Lynch analyst Thomas Kurlack of the two key memory chips used in computers.

lst.name: sentence

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: He said Japanese manufactures were likely to view MITI's request unfavorably because chip capacity was still high and production cut backs would lead to significant write-offs in plant and equipment.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: "We've seen the grey market begin to dry up for D-RAMS, and it has virtually dried up for EPROMS," said Merrill Lynch analyst Thomas Kurlack of the two key memory chips used in computers.
